title: Using The Webcam in Your Laptop to Take Photos

steps.title: Make sure your computer has a webcam.
steps.content: Make sure your computer has a webcam. If your laptop has a built-in webcam as most do, you can easily take a photo. If not, however, you'll need to install a webcam on your computer before continuing. [1] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source Some laptops have a physical shutter that you can toggle back and forth across the lens. Before taking a photo, check the camera lens (typically at the top-center part of the screen) and make sure the shutter is open.

steps.title: Open Start .
steps.content: Open Start . Click the Windows logo in the bottom-left corner of the screen, or press the Windows key on your keyboard. [2] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source

steps.title: Type camera into Start.
steps.content: Type camera into Start. This will search your computer for the Camera app, which allows you to take a photo with any attached camera. [3] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source

steps.title: Click Camera.
steps.content: Click Camera . It's a white, camera-shaped icon at the top of the Start window. Doing so will open your Windows Camera app. [4] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source Make sure to activate your camera with the proper permissions.

steps.title: Wait for your computer's camera to turn on.
steps.content: Wait for your computer's camera to turn on. A light next to your camera should come on once the camera is on, and you should see yourself in the Camera app's window.

steps.title: Face your computer toward whatever you want to photograph.
steps.content: Face your computer toward whatever you want to photograph. You should see your photograph subject's image on the screen.

steps.title: Click the "Capture" button.
steps.content: Click the "Capture" button. This camera-shaped icon is at the bottom of the Camera app window. Doing so will take a photo and save it to your Windows computer's Photographs app.

steps.title: Open Spotlight .
steps.content: Open Spotlight . Click the magnifying glass icon in the top-right corner of the screen.

steps.title: Type photo booth into Spotlight.
steps.content: Type photo booth into Spotlight. This will search your Mac for the Photo Booth app.

steps.title: Click Photo Booth.
steps.content: Click Photo Booth . It's the top result beneath the Spotlight search bar. Doing so will open your Mac's Photo Booth.

steps.title: Wait for your Mac's camera to turn on.
steps.content: Wait for your Mac's camera to turn on. When your Mac's camera is on, there will be a green light next to it. You should also see yourself appear on-screen in Photo Booth once the camera is on.

steps.title: Face the Mac's screen toward whatever you want to photograph.
steps.content: Face the Mac's screen toward whatever you want to photograph. Anything that appears in the main Photo Booth window will be a part of your photo, so feel free to adjust as needed based on what shows in the Photo Booth window. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Click the "Capture" button.
steps.content: Click the "Capture" button. This red-and-white camera button is at the bottom of the page. Doing so will take the picture and add it to your Mac's Photos app. [6] X Research source If you have an iPhone or iPad with Photo Stream enabled, the photo will also appear on your iPhone or iPad. You can add extra effects in Photo Booth such as a customized background .
